org.happy.artist.rmdmia.rcsm.providers.ros
Class ROSSubscriber

java.lang.Object
  org.happy.artist.rmdmia.rcsm.providers.ros.ROSSubscriber

public class ROSSubscriber
extends java.lang.Object

ROSSubscriber.java - An implementation of the ROS Slave Group for the ROSNode Master/Slave API implementation. The ROSSubscriber is intended to implement latching functionality for Topic Subscriptions that implement multiple topic advertisers (publishers via updatePublishers XML-RPC). Multiple publishers may be implemented for the purpose of higher bandwidth on multiple threads, or any number of purposes where multiple publishers work together to support a single topic.

Field Detail

topicIndice

public int topicIndice
Constructor Detail

ROSSubscriber

public ROSSubscriber(ROSNode rosNode,
                     java.lang.String topic,
                     java.lang.String topicType,
                     int initialGroupSize,
                     int topicIndice)
The ROSSubscriber represents an array of multiple ROS Publishers that are used by the ROSSlave Subscriber.

Parameters:
topic - - (String) The ROS Topic.
topicType - - (String) The ROS Topic Type.
initialGroupSize - - (int) initialGroupSize is the initial length of the ROSSlave array. Every added Slave over the initial length require reinitialization of the Arrays, thus causing a performance bottleneck when re-processing occurs for multiple Array initializations.
topicIndice - - the ROSNode Topic Indice assigned to this topic.

getInitialGroupSize

public int getInitialGroupSize()
Returns the starting array size of the publisher URI related arrays. This can be adjusted at instantiation for optimum performance. Every time the limit goes over arrays must be reconstructed.

getSlaveCount

public int getSlaveCount()
Returns the current number of Publisher URI associated with this ROS Slave Group.

shutdown

public void shutdown()
Shutdown the ROSSubscriber (topic listeners). Iteratively shutdown each ROSSlave.
